text: In classical antiquity, the cornucopia (from Latin cornu copiae), also called the horn of plenty, was a symbol of abundance and nourishment from Amaltheia, commonly a large horn-shaped container overflowing with produce, flowers or nuts. A common depiction of it comes from the Fruit of the Loom logo. Category:Greek mythology Category:Roman mythology Category:Symbols Category:Thanksgiving Category:Containers
title: Cornucopia
